title: Facebook Creating Video Tool For Users To Chat With Celebrities For Fee
text: Facebook is planning to roll out a new feature called Super to let people pay celebrities or content creators for the chance to interact with them on a live broadcast, Bloomberg reported, similar to the app Cameo. The Cameo app reflects the attitude during the pandemic in which public figures look to connect with fans […]

title: Facebook will move UK users to US terms, avoiding EU privacy laws
text: Company is reportedly making the change partly because the EU privacy regime is among the world's strictest

title: Facebook is creating a Cameo-like tool that lets you interact with celebs, report says
text: The video product is being tested internally, according to Bloomberg.

title: 'The way out is through': Zuckerberg, execs set Facebook roadmap at year-end meeting
text: Facebook Inc's top executives sought to rally employees around business priorities like commerce and virtual reality at a year-end meeting on Tuesday, playing down criticism faced this year of the company's record on false and violent speech.

title: Facebook Is Launching Its Own Version Of Cameo, OnlyFans: Report
text: Companies like Cameo and OnlyFans have made a killing in 2020. Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) is looking to get a slice of that pie by building a new video tool.

title: Facebook will lift temporary political ad ban in Georgia with control of Senate still in play
text: The company had put a temporary pause on electoral, political and social issue ads in the U.S. to try to prevent confusion or abuse on its platform.

title: Facebook takes swipe at Apple while supporting draft EU rules
text: Facebook Inc on Tuesday said it hopes new draft rules by the European Union aimed at curbing powers of big U.S. companies could set boundaries for Apple Inc, its latest volley in an ongoing feud.

title: Exclusive: Facebook to move UK users to California terms, avoiding EU privacy rules
text: Facebook Inc will shift all its users in the United Kingdom into user agreements with the corporate headquarters in California, moving them out of their current relationship with Facebook's Irish unit and out of reach of Europe's privacy laws.

title: Tech giants face tougher rules, big fines under EU plan
text: Big tech companies face hefty fines in Britain and the European Union if they treat rivals unfairly or fail to protect users on their platforms, in proposed regulations unveiled Tuesday by officials in London and Brussels. The EU outlined its long-awaited sweeping overhaul of digital regulations while the British government released its own plans to.

title: Instant View: U.S. tech firms face new EU rules for business practices
text: Big U.S. technology firms ranging from Apple to Facebook may have to change their business practices in Europe or face fines of as much as 10% of their annual turnover under new draft EU rules announced on Tuesday.

title: FTC orders tech giants to share information on how they handle data
text: Yahoo Finance's Alexis Keenan reports on the FTC cracking down on tech giants on how they track and handle data.

title: Explainer-Tough EU tech rules: here's the what, why and what comes next
text: The European Commission announced draft rules on Tuesday to rein in tech giants such as Alphabet's Google, Facebook, Apple and Amazon, the most significant among a raft of measures taken by regulators worldwide.

title: Europe lays out its plan to reboot digital rules and tame tech giants
text: European lawmakers have introduced two legislative proposals as part of a major policy reboot to update regional rules for digital business and rein in big tech.

title: New EU Rules Could Fine U.S. Tech Giants Billions
text: Companies like Apple, Google, Amazon and Facebook may face stiff fines if they engage in anti-competitive behavior or fail to act against illegal content.

title: Facebook's Legal Woes May Present a Buying Opportunity
text: Anti-trust lawsuits will affect the prices of Facebook stock for investors interested in adding the social media giant to their portfolio. The post Facebook's Legal Woes May Present a Buying Opportunity appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: The walls are closing in on Big Tech as global regulators crack down
text: The European Commission, the FTC and Ofcom have all announced new plans to regulate the tech giants in the last few days.

title: EU Digital Services and Digital Markets Acts: Europe's big tech regulation overhaul begins
text: The two pieces of proposed legislation will dictate how the EU regulates Big Tech for years to come.

title: EU announces sweeping new rules that could force breakups and hefty fines for Big Tech
text: Tech giants could soon face hefty fines and stricter controls over their behavior as part of new wide-sweeping rules in the European Union.

title: Europe threatens to break up Big Tech if it doesn't play by new rules
text: Officials across Europe on Tuesday unveiled legislation that would give regulators sweeping new powers to take on US tech giants, threatening huge fines and raising the prospect of breakups or bans for repeat offenders.

title: Big Fines and Strict Rules Unveiled Against ‘Big Tech' in Europe
text: European Union and British authorities released draft laws to halt the spread of harmful content and improve competition.

title: Big Tech could face break up and billion-dollar fines under new EU regulation being announced Tuesday
text: The executive branch of the European Union is scheduled to release two sweeping legislative proposals on Tuesday that will set the stage for regulating Big Tech in Europe.

title: EU Threatens Big Tech Breakup Over Anti-Competitive Practices
text: As Brussels published its tech legislation drafts, the European Union (EU) warned that it would break up Big Tech for repeated practices that are deemed anti-competitive, the Financial Times (FT) reported on Tuesday (Dec. 15).

title: Social media giants face big fines and blocked sites under new UK rules on harmful content
text: The proposals are part of the U.K. government's bid to force tech giants to rid their platforms of illegal and toxic content.

title: Facebook, YouTube, Twitter Face Multi-Billion Fines In UK Under Online Safety Legislation
text: Tech giants face fines in millions of pounds in the United Kingdom if they do not comply with the new online safety legislation under consideration, the Financial Times reported Monday.

title: U.S. tech giants face 6-10% fines as EU set rules to curb their power
text: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Alphabet unit Google may have to change their business practices in Europe or face hefty fines between 6-10% under new draft EU rules to be announced on Tuesday.
